casebody.data:
Joseph X. BETHEA, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Mr. DAGGETT, Acting Warden, Respondent-Appellee. No. 71-1078

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. June 23, 1971. *113Joseph X. Bethea, pro se. John W. Stokes, Jr., U. S. Atty., Richard H. Still, Jr., Charles A. Panned, Jr., Asst. U. S. Attys., Atlanta, Ga., for ap-pellee.

Before WISDOM, COLEMAN, and SIMPSON, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5 Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Company of New York et al., 5 Cir. 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

Affirmed.1 See Local Rule 21.2

. Tlie opinion of the district court is reported as Bethea v. Daggett, N.D.Ga. 1970, 329 F.Supp. 796.

. See N.L.R.B. v. Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, 5 Cir. 1970, 430 F.2d 966.
